subject: p11512104
History: -year-old with CHF, here with cough, question pneumonia, question volume status. Comparison is made to the patients prior study of at 16:03 AP upright and lateral views of the chest, at 17:37 are submitted.
Impression: The heart remains stably enlarged, which most likely reflects cardiomegaly, although pericardial effusion cannot be entirely excluded. Lungs appear grossly clear, though somewhat low in volume. No evidence of pulmonary edema or focal airspace consolidation to suggest pneumonia. No large effusions. No large pneumothorax is appreciated. Calcification of the aortic knob is consistent with atherosclerosis.
